column4: im having problems during boot... ubuntu 11.04 gives me some irq problem and then cap locks keeps blinking and ubuntu wont boot... i have to reboot 2-3 times to make it boot... what would be the problem?
seems kernelpanic, check your bios setting an rebuild intramfs
what am i supposed to look in my bios? its all in defaults...
it was working all ok until last kernel upgrade
make sure you can access grub's menu, and cd into boot and do : sudo updateinitramfs -u of your current kernel
ive done it... sudo update-initramfs -u && sudo update-grub && sudo grub-install /dev/sda
ill try downgrading the kernel then...
:  (/etc/default/grub) *
all there is default also...
:  beep and longer timeout can make choosing other kernel easier,case ongoing panics
weird bug
:  not occuring in my vm
i installed a 64bits version of ubuntu and now i have a 32bits kernel instead???? how can i see what my ubuntu version is??
:  ups, uname -a and lsb_release -a
it says i686... im sure i had 64bits installed...
:  cat /proc/version another place to look
